intro: Allionia incarnata var. incarnata, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a distinctive, fleshy root system that is often harvested for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
